name: Kepler-288
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-288 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-288 is a star with 1.085 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.09 times its radius. It is located 4031.97 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-288 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-288 b

Kepler-288 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.10 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-288.

The mass of Kepler-288 b is 3.29 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-288 b is 1.67 that of Earth. At 3.29 Earth masses, Kepler-288 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-288 c

Kepler-288 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.14 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 19.31 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-288.

The mass of Kepler-288 c is 11.85 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-288 c is 2.85 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-288 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-288 d

Kepler-288 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.29 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 56.63 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-288.

The mass of Kepler-288 d is 10.14 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-288 d is 2.67 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-288 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-288, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
